pkgmetadata.longdescription: Gene-Set Analysis via Decorrelation by Orthogonal Transformation // Decorrelates a set of summary statistics (i.e., Z-scores or P-values per SNP) via Decorrelation by Orthogonal Transformation (DOT) approach and performs gene-set analyses by combining transformed statistic values; operations are performed with algorithms that rely only on the association summary results and the linkage disequilibrium (LD). For more details on DOT and its power, see Olga (2020) doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1007819.
